title: 115_s62
content: The Act may be cited as the "January 8th National Memorial Act" and includes findings. The tragedy on January 8, 2011, at Congresswoman Gabrielle Gifford's event resulted in the deaths of 6 people and injuries to 13 others, including Giffords herself. It was the first assassination attempt on a Congressional Member during a constituent meeting, leaving Giffords with severe injuries. The community came together in support after the tragedy. The Arizona community united after the tragic assassination attempt on Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords in 2011. Three memorial sites were established to honor the victims, and a permanent memorial will serve as a tribute to the resilience of the community and democracy in the United States. "January 8th National Memorial established in honor of victims of tragic assassination attempt on Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords in 2011." The January 8th National Memorial, established to honor victims of the tragic assassination attempt on Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords in 2011, is affiliated with the National Park System. The Foundation responsible for the Memorial must comply with certain requirements before its establishment. The Foundation has established a trust fund for receiving donations and managing the construction, operation, and maintenance of the Memorial. The Memorial will be managed by the Foundation and will cease to be affiliated with the National Park System if not managed according to the law. The Secretary may provide technical assistance and enter into cooperative agreements with the Foundation for financial assistance with marketing the Memorial. The Secretary, in consultation with the Foundation, shall develop a general management plan for the Memorial. The Secretary, in consultation with the Foundation, will develop a general management plan for the Memorial in accordance with the relevant section of the United States Code. The plan must be submitted to the appropriate congressional committees within 3 years of funds being available or the Memorial's establishment.
